text: 12 As Elinor and Marianne were walking together the next morning the latter communicated a piece of news to her sister , which in spite of all that she knew before of Marianne 's imprudence and want of thought , surprised her by its extravagant testimony of both .
text_tokenized: 12 As Elinor and Marianne were walking together the next morning the latter communicated a piece of news to her sister , which in spite of all that she knew before of Marianne 's imprudence and want of thought , surprised her by its extravagant testimony of both .

text: Marianne told her , with the greatest delight , that Willoughby had given her a horse , one that he had bred himself on his estate in Somersetshire , and which was exactly calculated to carry a woman . Without considering that it was not in her mother 's plan to keep any horse , that if she were to alter her resolution in favour of this gift , she must buy another for the servant , and keep a servant to ride it , and after all , build a stable to receive them , she had accepted the present without hesitation , and told her sister of it in raptures . " He intends to send his groom into Somersetshire immediately for it , " she added , " and when it arrives we will ride every day .

text: She was faithful to her word ; and when Willoughby called at the cottage , the same day , Elinor heard her express her disappointment to him in a low voice , on being obliged to forego the acceptance of his present . The reasons for this alteration were at the same time related , and they were such as to make further entreaty on his side impossible . His concern however was very apparent ; and after expressing it with earnestness , he added , in the same low voice,--"But , Marianne , the horse is still yours , though you can not use it now . I shall keep it only till you can claim it .

" Most grateful did Elinor feel to Lady Middleton for observing , at this moment , " that it rained very hard , " though she believed the interruption to proceed less from any attention to her , than from her ladyship 's great dislike of all such inelegant subjects of raillery as delighted her husband and mother . The idea however started by her , was immediately pursued by Colonel Brandon , who was on every occasion mindful of the feelings of others ; and much was said on the subject of rain by both of them .

text: Willoughby opened the piano - forte , and asked Marianne to sit down to it ; and thus amidst the various endeavours of different people to quit the topic , it fell to the ground . But not so easily did Elinor recover from the alarm into which it had thrown her . A party was formed this evening for going on the following day to see a very fine place about twelve miles from Barton , belonging to a brother - in - law of Colonel Brandon , without whose interest it could not be seen , as the proprietor , who was then abroad , had left strict orders on that head .

text: The grounds were declared to be highly beautiful , and Sir John , who was particularly warm in their praise , might be allowed to be a tolerable judge , for he had formed parties to visit them , at least , twice every summer for the last ten years . They contained a noble piece of water ; a sail on which was to a form a great part of the morning 's amusement ; cold provisions were to be taken , open carriages only to be employed , and every thing conducted in the usual style of a complete party of pleasure .

text: He wished her a good morning , and , attended by Sir John , left the room .

text: The complaints and lamentations which politeness had hitherto restrained , now burst forth universally ; and they all agreed again and again how provoking it was to be so disappointed .
text_tokenized: The complaints and lamentations which politeness had hitherto restrained , now burst forth universally ; and they all agreed again and again how provoking it was to be so disappointed .

text: " I can guess what his business is , however , " said Mrs. Jennings exultingly .
text_tokenized: " I can guess what his business is , however , " said Mrs. Jennings exultingly .

text: " Can you , ma'am ? " said almost every body .
text_tokenized: " Can you , ma'am ? " said almost every body .

text: " Yes ; it is about Miss Williams , I am sure . "
text_tokenized: " Yes ; it is about Miss Williams , I am sure . "

text: " And who is Miss Williams ? " asked Marianne .
text_tokenized: " And who is Miss Williams ? " asked Marianne .

text: What !
text_tokenized: What !

text: do not you know who Miss Williams is ?
text_tokenized: do not you know who Miss Williams is ?

text: I am sure you must have heard of her before .
text_tokenized: I am sure you must have heard of her before .

text: She is a relation of the Colonel 's , my dear ; a very near relation .
text_tokenized: She is a relation of the Colonel 's , my dear ; a very near relation .

text: We will not say how near , for fear of shocking the young ladies .
text_tokenized: We will not say how near , for fear of shocking the young ladies .

text: " Then , lowering her voice a little , she said to Elinor , " She is his natural daughter . " " Indeed ! " " Oh , yes ; and as like him as she can stare . I dare say the Colonel will leave her all his fortune . " When Sir John returned , he joined most heartily in the general regret on so unfortunate an event ; concluding however by observing , that as they were all got together , they must do something by way of being happy ; and after some consultation it was agreed , that although happiness could only be enjoyed at Whitwell , they might procure a tolerable composure of mind by driving about the country .
text_tokenized: " Then , lowering her voice a little , she said to Elinor , " She is his natural daughter . " " Indeed ! " " Oh , yes ; and as like him as she can stare . I dare say the Colonel will leave her all his fortune . " When Sir John returned , he joined most heartily in the general regret on so unfortunate an event ; concluding however by observing , that as they were all got together , they must do something by way of being happy ; and after some consultation it was agreed , that although happiness could only be enjoyed at Whitwell , they might procure a tolerable composure of mind by driving about the country .

text: The carriages were then ordered ; Willoughby 's was first , and Marianne never looked happier than when she got into it .
text_tokenized: The carriages were then ordered ; Willoughby 's was first , and Marianne never looked happier than when she got into it .

text: He drove through the park very fast , and they were soon out of sight ; and nothing more of them was seen till their return , which did not happen till after the return of all the rest . They both seemed delighted with their drive ; but said only in general terms that they had kept in the lanes , while the others went on the downs . It was settled that there should be a dance in the evening , and that every body should be extremely merry all day long .
text_tokenized: He drove through the park very fast , and they were soon out of sight ; and nothing more of them was seen till their return , which did not happen till after the return of all the rest . They both seemed delighted with their drive ; but said only in general terms that they had kept in the lanes , while the others went on the downs . It was settled that there should be a dance in the evening , and that every body should be extremely merry all day long .

text: Some more of the Careys came to dinner , and they had the pleasure of sitting down nearly twenty to table , which Sir John observed with great contentment .
text_tokenized: Some more of the Careys came to dinner , and they had the pleasure of sitting down nearly twenty to table , which Sir John observed with great contentment .

text: Willoughby took his usual place between the two elder Miss Dashwoods .
text_tokenized: Willoughby took his usual place between the two elder Miss Dashwoods .

text: Mrs. Jennings sat on Elinor 's right hand ; and they had not been long seated , before she leant behind her and Willoughby , and said to Marianne , loud enough for them both to hear , " I have found you out in spite of all your tricks .
text_tokenized: Mrs. Jennings sat on Elinor 's right hand ; and they had not been long seated , before she leant behind her and Willoughby , and said to Marianne , loud enough for them both to hear , " I have found you out in spite of all your tricks .

text: I know where you spent the morning . " Marianne coloured , and replied very hastily , " Where , pray?"-- " Did not you know , " said Willoughby , " that we had been out in my curricle ? " " Yes , yes , Mr. Impudence , I know that very well , and I was determined to find out WHERE you had been to.-- I hope you like your house , Miss Marianne . It is a very large one , I know ; and when I come to see you , I hope you will have new - furnished it , for it wanted it very much when I was there six years ago . " Marianne turned away in great confusion .
text_tokenized: I know where you spent the morning . " Marianne coloured , and replied very hastily , " Where , pray?"-- " Did not you know , " said Willoughby , " that we had been out in my curricle ? " " Yes , yes , Mr. Impudence , I know that very well , and I was determined to find out WHERE you had been to.-- I hope you like your house , Miss Marianne . It is a very large one , I know ; and when I come to see you , I hope you will have new - furnished it , for it wanted it very much when I was there six years ago . " Marianne turned away in great confusion .

text: Mrs. Jennings laughed heartily ; and Elinor found that in her resolution to know where they had been , she had actually made her own woman enquire of Mr. Willoughby 's groom ; and that she had by that method been informed that they had gone to Allenham , and spent a considerable time there in walking about the garden and going all over the house . Elinor could hardly believe this to be true , as it seemed very unlikely that Willoughby should propose , or Marianne consent , to enter the house while Mrs. Smith was in it , with whom Marianne had not the smallest acquaintance . As soon as they left the dining - room , Elinor enquired of her about it ; and great was her surprise when she found that every circumstance related by Mrs. Jennings was perfectly true .
text_tokenized: Mrs. Jennings laughed heartily ; and Elinor found that in her resolution to know where they had been , she had actually made her own woman enquire of Mr. Willoughby 's groom ; and that she had by that method been informed that they had gone to Allenham , and spent a considerable time there in walking about the garden and going all over the house . Elinor could hardly believe this to be true , as it seemed very unlikely that Willoughby should propose , or Marianne consent , to enter the house while Mrs. Smith was in it , with whom Marianne had not the smallest acquaintance . As soon as they left the dining - room , Elinor enquired of her about it ; and great was her surprise when she found that every circumstance related by Mrs. Jennings was perfectly true .

text: Marianne was quite angry with her for doubting it .
text_tokenized: Marianne was quite angry with her for doubting it .

text: " Why should you imagine , Elinor , that we did not go there , or that we did not see the house ?
text_tokenized: " Why should you imagine , Elinor , that we did not go there , or that we did not see the house ?

text: Is not it what you have often wished to do yourself ? "
text_tokenized: Is not it what you have often wished to do yourself ? "

text: " Yes , Marianne , but I would not go while Mrs. Smith was there , and with no other companion than Mr. Willoughby . " " Mr. Willoughby however is the only person who can have a right to shew that house ; and as he went in an open carriage , it was impossible to have any other companion .
text_tokenized: " Yes , Marianne , but I would not go while Mrs. Smith was there , and with no other companion than Mr. Willoughby . " " Mr. Willoughby however is the only person who can have a right to shew that house ; and as he went in an open carriage , it was impossible to have any other companion .

text: I never spent a pleasanter morning in my life . " " I am afraid , " replied Elinor , " that the pleasantness of an employment does not always evince its propriety . " " On the contrary , nothing can be a stronger proof of it , Elinor ; for if there had been any real impropriety in what I did , I should have been sensible of it at the time , for we always know when we are acting wrong , and with such a conviction I could have had no pleasure .
text_tokenized: I never spent a pleasanter morning in my life . " " I am afraid , " replied Elinor , " that the pleasantness of an employment does not always evince its propriety . " " On the contrary , nothing can be a stronger proof of it , Elinor ; for if there had been any real impropriety in what I did , I should have been sensible of it at the time , for we always know when we are acting wrong , and with such a conviction I could have had no pleasure .

text: " But , my dear Marianne , as it has already exposed you to some very impertinent remarks , do you not now begin to doubt the discretion of your own conduct ?
text_tokenized: " But , my dear Marianne , as it has already exposed you to some very impertinent remarks , do you not now begin to doubt the discretion of your own conduct ?

text: " If the impertinent remarks of Mrs. Jennings are to be the proof of impropriety in conduct , we are all offending every moment of our lives .
text_tokenized: " If the impertinent remarks of Mrs. Jennings are to be the proof of impropriety in conduct , we are all offending every moment of our lives .

text: I value not her censure any more than I should do her commendation .
text_tokenized: I value not her censure any more than I should do her commendation .

text: I am not sensible of having done anything wrong in walking over Mrs. Smith 's grounds , or in seeing her house .
text_tokenized: I am not sensible of having done anything wrong in walking over Mrs. Smith 's grounds , or in seeing her house .

text: They will one day be Mr. Willoughby 's , and-- " " If they were one day to be your own , Marianne , you would not be justified in what you have done . " She blushed at this hint ; but it was even visibly gratifying to her ; and after a ten minutes ' interval of earnest thought , she came to her sister again , and said with great good humour , " Perhaps , Elinor , it WAS rather ill - judged in me to go to Allenham ; but Mr. Willoughby wanted particularly to shew me the place ; and it is a charming house , I assure you.--There is one remarkably pretty sitting room up stairs ; of a nice comfortable size for constant use , and with modern furniture it would be delightful .
text_tokenized: They will one day be Mr. Willoughby 's , and-- " " If they were one day to be your own , Marianne , you would not be justified in what you have done . " She blushed at this hint ; but it was even visibly gratifying to her ; and after a ten minutes ' interval of earnest thought , she came to her sister again , and said with great good humour , " Perhaps , Elinor , it WAS rather ill - judged in me to go to Allenham ; but Mr. Willoughby wanted particularly to shew me the place ; and it is a charming house , I assure you.--There is one remarkably pretty sitting room up stairs ; of a nice comfortable size for constant use , and with modern furniture it would be delightful .

text: It is a corner room , and has windows on two sides .
text_tokenized: It is a corner room , and has windows on two sides .

text: On one side you look across the bowling - green , behind the house , to a beautiful hanging wood , and on the other you have a view of the church and village , and , beyond them , of those fine bold hills that we have so often admired .
text_tokenized: On one side you look across the bowling - green , behind the house , to a beautiful hanging wood , and on the other you have a view of the church and village , and , beyond them , of those fine bold hills that we have so often admired .

text: I did not see it to advantage , for nothing could be more forlorn than the furniture,--but if it were newly fitted up -- a couple of hundred pounds , Willoughby says , would make it one of the pleasantest summer - rooms in England .
text_tokenized: I did not see it to advantage , for nothing could be more forlorn than the furniture,--but if it were newly fitted up -- a couple of hundred pounds , Willoughby says , would make it one of the pleasantest summer - rooms in England .

text: " Could Elinor have listened to her without interruption from the others , she would have described every room in the house with equal delight .
text_tokenized: " Could Elinor have listened to her without interruption from the others , she would have described every room in the house with equal delight .
